content.description:
Yosemite start into sustained thoughtful face moves. 

  . . (Perhaps a bit easier if taller than 5ft 7in; likely much harder if less tall than 5ft 6in with normal reach). 

  Up the wide crack on right side of protrusion.   . . Variation: Up over left side of protrusion (perhaps more fun but less "Yosemite").   More or less straight to the top, staying right of the obvious vertical crack (which is the route God Jam). 

warning: Loose rock is still a concern here. Belayer or other members of party should not stand anywhere near underneath the climber.
content.protection:
Top-Roping: Static line from natural protection is obvious way to set up top anchor. 

  For more ideas how to set up Top-Rope, see description of the Dime Store sector just left of this. 

  Lead? Protection for Trad leading is unknown and likely inadequate.
content.location:
Start on rock with sharp left top which is right from big low roof with vertical crack rising out its right side, and left below wide crack going up on right side of protruding rock about 10 ft up. 

  - - > see on this Photo

content.description: Start on top of the boulder which has fallen and created a low overhand.  First hold is flat ledge with sidepull in the center.  Move left, find the hidden crimp left of the crack and then use the pocket in the crack to move up right.  Crux is in the first few moves, but climbing is sustained and challenging above.  Named in honor of a brave kitten from Brooklyn.
content.location: Around the corner to the left of God Jam Roof, starting on top of the boulder which has obviously detached from the wall.

climbs.name: God Jammit! I Wish I was strong enough!

content.description:
This route is for the people that want to do God Jam Roof but are too weak (me). This route starts just below where the crack turns from the right side of the big, low roof up to the face.  Start on the knife edge rock below right from the crack.  Then go up left to the crack and through the overhang. 

  . . Variation: Do the bottom sequence with Aid, perhaps a shoulder stand --  See this photo -- (FA - Rutherc Rutherfurd 2016). 

  Cruise up the splitter crack and go into the balancy mantle (mental crux) and finish with a few slab moves.
content.protection: A few cams .5 to #2.  To make this climb G, we swung a #9 hex into the crack to protect the crux. This avoids decking into the sharp rock below
content.location: Walk right past the Rock Dojo bouldering. Follow to the God Jam cave, below left from the obvious vertical crack. Start on the knife edge rock below left from the crack.

content.description: Start way inside the cave in the middle of the buttress and below a crack. Make some chimney moves to reach the crack and face.  Join the route "God Jammit! I Wish" and cruise the easier crack until it ends. End with a balcony move and a few slab moves to top out.
content.protection: Seems to take cams .5 to 3 in the roof and then similar size for the crack above. Easy to see and decide for yourself.
content.location: In the obvious cave in the middle of God Jam Buttress, with a vertical crack above.

content.description:
Nice climbing if want to practice slopy feet with no handholds. 

  A bit easier if use the tree to get off the ground, and stop just before topping out. More interesting to not use tree and finish with feet up on top. 

  Start just left of big tree which is about ten feet right from the obvious wide gully. Up the face toward the top of the arete rising from left. Join the final section of the arete and finish on its top.  

warning: Loose rock is still a concern here. Belayer or other members of party should not stand anywhere near underneath the climber.
content.protection:
Top-Roping: Long static line from natural protection is obvious way to set up top. Careful to select anchor point so to avoid having a falling climber swing sideways left off the arete. 

  For more ideas how to set up Top-Rope, see description of the Dime Store sector just left of this. 

  Lead? Protection for Trad leading is unknown and likely inadequate.
content.location:
About ten feet right slightly downhill from the obvious wide gully (the route "Dojo top-bottom Access") between sector Dime Store and sector God Jam, by big healthly tree. 

  - - > see on this Photo

content.description:
Nice climbing on not the best arete at Powerlinez, with one or two thoughtful moves. 

  Start on left side of tree, up the ridge, but exit left just before its top. 

warning: Loose rock is still a concern here. Belayer or other members of party should not stand anywhere near underneath the climber.
content.protection:
Top-Roping: Long static line from natural protection is obvious way to set up top. Careful to select anchor point so to avoid having a falling climber swing sideways left off the arete. 

  For more ideas how to set up Top-Rope, see description of the Dime Store sector just left of this. 

  Lead? Protection for Trad leading is unknown and likely inadequate.
content.location:
Along the right side of the obvious wide gully (the route "Dojo top-bottom Access") between sector Dime Store and sector God Jam. Find tree on right side near bottom of gully, see ridge/arete rising up from tree alongside the gully. 

  - - > see on this Photo

  . . . . or on this Photo

content.description: Finger crack that moves up and to the right. Starts on a ledge about 15 feet off the ground. Tough getting started, a little easier after that.
content.protection: Lots of placements - microcams and small nuts/tricams will give you more options to keep the better handholds available.
content.location: Look for a ledge halfway up the face, right of God Jam and Naked Singularity. Walk up the ramp from the right side to the crack.

content.description: This wall is defined by the beautiful crack that goes through a 15 foot roof then up the wall.  though this route is steep, there are a few routes on the wall that are more moderate.
